kw.name: Open Application
kw.arg: appium:deviceName=Samsung Galaxy S9 FHD GoogleAPI Emulator
kw.doc: Opens a new application to given Appium server. Capabilities of appium server, Android and iOS, Please check https://appium.io/docs/en/2.1/cli/args/ | *Option* | *Man.* | *Description* | | remote_url | Yes | Appium server url | | alias | no | alias | | strict_ssl | No | allows you to send commands to an invalid certificate host like a self-signed one. |

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Swipe
kw.doc: Swipe from one point to another point, for an optional duration.

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Click Element
kw.msg: Clicking element 'xpath=//android.widget.Button[@content-desc="Tap to add product to cart"]'.
xpath criteria: //android.widget.Button[@content-desc="Tap to add product to cart"]

kw.name: Set Variable
kw.msg: ${ico_carrinho} = xpath=//android.widget.RelativeLayout[@content-desc="Displays number of items in your cart"]/android.widget.ImageView
kw.arg: xpath=//android.widget.RelativeLayout[@content-desc="Displays number of items in your cart"]/android.widget.ImageView
kw.doc: Returns the given values which can then be assigned to a variables.

kw.name: Element Text Should Be
kw.msg: Verifying element 'xpath=//android.widget.TextView[@resource-id="com.saucelabs.mydemoapp.android:id/titleTV"]' contains exactly text 'Sauce Labs Backpack'.
kw.doc: Verifies element identified by ``locator`` exactly contains text ``expected``.

kw.name: Close Application
kw.doc: Closes the current application and also close webdriver session.
